page.title: 11TEMPLE GROVE SCHOOL
page.content: One of the oldest preparatory schools in the country occupies a large house at Herons Ghyll, surrounded by 4O acres of land. Formerly for boys only, Temple Grove in l984 opened its doors to girls as well and now has lO3 pupils aged 7 - l3, 70 of them boarders, and a pre-prep department of 58 aged 3 to 7. There are l7 on the teaching staff, 6 living in. The school prepares children for the public schools' Common Entrance exams and scholarships and provides a wide variety of sport and other out of school activities. A Gilbert and Sullivan opera is produced every year and enjoyed by parents and local people. The school choir sings once a year at High Hurstwood church and visits other nearby churches.
